feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Dense Fog Advisory issued August 20 at 5:02PM AKDT until August 21 at 7:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM AKDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Visibility one quarter mile or less in dense fog. * WHERE...Sitka. * WHEN...Until 7 AM AKDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Hazardous travel conditions due to low visibility.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Cape Decision to Salisbury Sound Coastal Area

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 20 at 3:14PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Glacier Dammed lake release causing debris to flow into Controller Bay... Satellite observations indicate that the Berg glacier dammed lake, located 65 miles east of Cordova, has likely released downstream into the Gandil River, Bering River and Bering Lake. High water from this glacier dammed lake release usually lasts for several days with large areas

entry.title: Wind Advisory issued August 20 at 1:25PM AKDT until August 21 at 5:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM AKDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...South winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph. * WHERE...Near Donnelly Dome. * WHEN...Until 5 AM AKDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects.

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued August 19 at 2:00PM AKDT until August 21 at 7:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM AKDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Including the following area, Western Kenai Peninsula. * WHEN...Until 215 PM AKDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 3:16AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Greene, northeastern Craighead, northwestern Mississippi, central Clay and southwestern Dunklin Counties through 345 AM CDT... At 316 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Peach Orchard to near Beech Grove to near Fontaine. Movement was southeast at 40 mph.

entry.title: High Surf Advisory issued August 20 at 1:07PM SST by NWS
entry.summary: ...A High Surf Advisory remains in effect... * WHAT...Surf of 10 to 13 feet. * WHERE...South and east facing shores of all islands. * WHEN...through Sunday. * IMPACTS...Minor. Expect some strong breaking waves, shorebreak, and strong longshore and rip currents making swimming difficult
entry.cap:areaDesc: Manua; Swains Island; Tutuila and Aunuu

entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 AM MST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected over the Aquarius Mountains east of Wikieup. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Arizona, including the following county, Mohave. * WHEN...Until 445 AM MST.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 1:11AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwest Yavapai County through 145 AM MST... At 111 AM MST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles northeast of Burro Creek Campground to 6 miles south of Ponderosa Park. Movement was south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Yavapai County Mountains; Yavapai County Valleys and Basins

entry.title: Flash Flood Warning issued August 21 at 12:30AM MST until August 21 at 3:15AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 AM MST EARLY THIS MORNING FOR MARICOPA AND EAST CENTRAL LA PAZ COUNTIES... At 1230 AM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms have produced heavy rain within the Centennial Wash and Tiger Wash basins. Up to 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.

entry.summary: ...PATCHY DENSE FOG THIS MORNING... Patchy dense fog can be expected this morning. Visibility will be reduced to around a quarter mile at times. The fog will begin to burn off after 7 am. Extra caution should be used if traveling this morning.

entry.summary: ...AREAS OF DENSE FOG THROUGH THIS MORNING... Widespread fog, with areas of dense fog, are being observed early this morning.
